action.action-desc: Mr. Takano (for himself, Mr. Van Hollen, Mr. Delaney, Ms. Tsongas, and Mr. Ted Lieu of California) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To require a demonstration program on the accession as Air Force officers of candidates with auditory impairments.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Keith Nolan Air Force Deaf Demonstration Act of 2015.

section.header: Demonstration program on accession of candidates with auditory impairments as air force officers

subsection.text: Beginning not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Air Force shall carry out a demonstration program to assess the feasibility and advisability of permitting individuals with auditory impairments (including deafness) to access as officers of the Air Force.

paragraph.text: The total number of individuals with auditory impairments who may participate in the demonstration program shall be not fewer than 15 individuals or more than 20 individuals.

paragraph.header: Mix and range of auditory impairments
paragraph.text: The individuals who participate in the demonstration program shall include individuals who are deaf and individuals who have a range of other auditory impairments.

Any individual who is chosen to participate in the demonstration program shall meet all essential qualifications for accession as an officer in the Air Force, other than those related to having an auditory impairment.
The Secretary of the Air Force shall—

subparagraph.text: publicize the demonstration program nationally, including to individuals who have auditory impairments and would be otherwise qualified for officer training;
create a process whereby interested individuals can apply for the demonstration program; and
select the participants for the demonstration program, from among the pool of applicants, based on the criteria in subsection (b).

paragraph.header: No prior service as air force officers
paragraph.text: Participants selected for the demonstration program shall be individuals who have not previously served as officers in the Air Force.

The participants in the demonstration program shall undergo, at the election of the Secretary of the Air Force, the Basic Officer Training course or the Commissioned Officer Training course at Maxwell Air Force Base, Alabama.

Once individuals begin participating in the demonstration program, each Basic Officer Training course or Commissioned Officer Training course at Maxwell Air Force Base, Alabama, shall include not fewer than 4, or more than 6, participants in the demonstration program until all participants have completed such training.

The Secretary of Defense shall ensure that participants in the demonstration program have the necessary auxiliary aids and services (as that term is defined in section 4 of the Americans With Disabilities Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 12103)) in order to fully participate in the demonstration program.

The Secretary of the Air Force shall designate a special advisor to the demonstration program to act as a resource for participants in the demonstration program, as well as a liaison between participants in the demonstration program and those providing the officer training.
The special advisor shall be a member of the Armed Forces on active duty—

clause.text: if a commissioned officer, shall be in grade O–3 or higher; or
if an enlisted member, shall be in grade E–5 or higher; and

subparagraph.text: who is knowledgeable about issues involving, and accommodations for, individuals with auditory impairments (including deafness).

paragraph.text: The special advisor shall be responsible for facilitating the officer training for participants in the demonstration program, intervening and resolving issues and accommodations during the training, and such other duties as the Secretary of the Air Force may assign to facilitate the success of the demonstration program and participants.

subsection.text: Not later than two years after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on the demonstration program. The report shall include the following:

paragraph.text: A description of the demonstration program and the participants in the demonstration program.
The outcome of the demonstration program, including—

subparagraph.text: the number of participants in the demonstration program that successfully completed the Basic Officer Training course or the Commissioned Officer Training course;
the number of participants in the demonstration program that were recommended for continued military service;
the issues that were encountered during the program; and

such recommendation for modifications to the demonstration program as the Secretary considers appropriate to increase further inclusion of individuals with auditory disabilities serving as officers in the Air Force or other Armed Forces.

paragraph.text: Such recommendations for legislative or administrative action as the Secretary considers appropriate in light of the demonstration program.

subsection.text: In this section, the term appropriate committees of Congress means—

paragraph.text: the Committee on Armed Services, the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions, and the Committee on Appropriations of the Senate; and
the Committee on Armed Services and the Committee on Appropriations of the House of Representatives.
